Hoboken.New York Savings Bank: The New York Savings Bank building in Manhattan was built in 1896 by Robert Henderson Robertson with George Provot, and was added to the National Register of Historic Places on January 7, 2000. From 1992 until 2004, the building became a branch of Central Rug & Carpet Mart owned by the Itzhak Timianko and Samuel Longwill. In 2005 it became a Balducci's food market.
